I have said it before and I will say it again - Harrods is my absolute 'must go to' Store when I am in London!  There is something for everyone with every budget. I felt welcomed and my need was met swiftly

The lady who helped me was passionate about the make up brand that I was enquiring about, she also fully supported me to choose the right shade and also give me some great advice as to how to get the best of the product and also what are the products to pair it with which I then also decided to buy as I could see how amazing they were, when she put them on my skin. She gave amazing advice and also nothing was a trouble. The next time I come back I will definitely try and find that lady again as she was really incredible.Very very happy and it was my first time in my 42 years being shade matched and supported to find products which were really great and I could instantly tell the difference.

The level of service I received from both the duty manager at the hair salon and the customer service team reflects the disregard Harrods today has for its clients.I have been going to the same hairstylist for over 10 years, but on this occasion, he was unavailable, so I was seen by someone else. I encountered an issue with this hairstylist, who was deliberately vague about the cost of a service. When I inquired about the price of trimming 3cm off my hair‚Äîon top of several other services, including a blow dry‚Äîhis response was simply, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the price of a haircut.‚Äù At the till, I was shocked to learn that this so-called ‚Äúhaircut‚Äù cost ¬£115, in addition to the ¬£80 blow dry. Had I been given an accurate price upfront, I would have declined the service, especially since I hadn‚Äôt initially booked it and was only asked on the spot if I wanted a trim.While the price itself is excessive for what was done, my main issue lies in the way I was treated. Both the salon staff and customer service were rude, condescending, and dismissive, defending the lack of clear pricing as acceptable. According to consumer rights, this was neither transparent nor fair‚Äîit was outright misleading.Rather than acknowledging the mistake, I was forced to argue my case for over an hour across multiple floors, in full view of other customers. The lack of discretion and basic courtesy only added to the humiliation.It‚Äôs disappointing to see that Harrods would rather lose a loyal client‚Äîwho spends tens of thousands of pounds a year in-store and has trusted the same hairstylist for over a decade‚Äîover something that could have been resolved with a simple admission of fault.For reference, my Rewards number is 7042776316506435, should customer service wish to verify this experience.
Great service, very relaxed. My pedicure was amazing and my toes look beautiful! Thank you !

I had an amazing shopping experience thanks to Connor from Tom Ford and Enrico from Dior‚Äîboth went above and beyond to help me find exactly what I needed!Enrico was incredibly kind and patient, assisting me in trying on different shoes until I found the perfect fit. His friendly and attentive approach made the entire interaction so enjoyable.Connor was equally helpful in trying to track down a perfume sample I had received a few months ago. Although we couldn't find the exact one, he took the time to guide me through other scents until I discovered the perfect alternative. He also informed me about a ¬£80 makeup deal that's redeemable, which really enhanced my experience and encouraged me to return in the future.Although I didn't make a purchase at Gucci, I stopped by with my partner to have a look, and the experience was wonderful. The sales associate was incredibly lovely she helped me try on a bag that was absolutely perfect! She took the time to explain everything I needed to know about it and was so personable and friendly. Her warm and engaging approach made the visit truly enjoyable. üíï Their excellent service and genuine care made all the difference‚ÄîI'll definitely be back!

I recently made a purchase of a luxury item valued at ¬£710 from Harrods, expecting a seamless shopping experience befitting their renowned reputation. Unfortunately, the service I received was far from the high standard one would expect from such a prestigious store.I placed my order over the phone, and it arrived via post; however, the condition of the package was incredibly disappointing. The box was ripped open, and the contents inside were damaged. It was clear that the item had not been properly handled or protected during shipping, which is especially concerning given the high value of the purchase.As a customer who trusted Harrods to deliver quality service and luxury items in pristine condition, I am truly let down by this experience. The lack of care in packaging and the obvious damage to the product are unacceptable for a company that prides itself on providing top-tier products and service.I have reached out to customer service on numerous occasions for a resolution, but the process has been frustrating and far from the level of support one would expect when dealing with such a high-end retailer. It's disheartening that a luxury store like Harrods doesn't seem to prioritise customer satisfaction or properly safeguard their products during delivery.I hope this review serves as a cautionary tale for anyone considering ordering from Harrods, especially expensive luxury goods. While their reputation precedes them, this experience has been a stark reminder that even established luxury brands can fall short in delivering a seamless and enjoyable customer experience.
Great service by this incredible member of staff, Barbara üå∫
Gabrielle served me today and she was very helpful. I am new to makeup and she was very patient and informative and gave me useful tips. She listened to what I needed and found the right products.

Went into Harrods today because it was my birthday about 1 o‚Äôclock was feeling quite hungry so thought I‚Äôd go into the fish restaurant that I was directed to was no queue up which was great. Went to go and sit down but the chairs didn‚Äôt move. They were sorted like fixed, which was a bit off putting But started to read the menu then I saw the chef start sneezing into a handkerchief over the food, it totally put me off and ruined my day. I walked out of the restaurant and went to Peter Jones and had food in there. I couldn‚Äôt believe that a world famous Establishment have such badly trained chefs if he had a cold He should not be in the restaurant serving food he should be at home resting But sneezing over the food is absolutely disgusting And goes against every health and safety regulation So because of this shocking horrible experience I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd ever be going back to Harrods For any of my birthdays With Covid and flu If they‚Äôre ill, should not be at work got this onAt Harrods, we take food safety and hygiene incredibly seriously, and we sincerely apologise for any discomfort this experience may have caused. Please rest assured that your feedback has been recorded and maintaining the highest standards of service and cleanliness is our priority.10 working days after I got totally disappointed with Harrods fish restaurant with the service chef or person sneezing over the food No one has contacted me back since the My second email I sent back Still waiting to see what they‚Äôre going to do, why is it taking so long? I cannot believe in a restaurant or shop that‚Äôs world famous That they would have staff sneezing over the food Doesn‚Äôt look like I will ever be going back thanks for ruining my birthday.this show how much you don't care about your customers.

I‚Äôve left a review previously BUT I feel I need to leave another!!! ONE STAR IS TOO MUCH! I‚Äôve gone past the crying and upset stage now and I‚Äôm just angry!! HARRODS ARE THE WORST COMPANY EVER!!!!! The customer service is next to SHITE!!!!! I honestly don‚Äôt no who they think they are! ROBBERY is what they do! Harrods are theiving scums! They are quite quick to take thousands of hard earned money off people and refuse to give it back! I have been fighting something for almost 5 months now! They‚Äôve had the item I returned to them 15th October 2024 AND my money since! I‚Äôve asked them to dispatch it back to me‚Ä¶.today (a week later) I get an ‚Äúapology‚Äù email for the late reply with the tracking details I‚Äôve chased up twice this past week‚Ä¶.to realise the item was finally coming back‚Ä¶but the courier was due in the next 30mins! Is that a joke! So I‚Äôve had to rush home from work!! Just when I honestly thought they couldn‚Äôt get any worse‚Ä¶..that was just the icing on the top of the cake!!! Would I use them again, NEVER!!!! Would I recommend them, NEVER! Would I visit a store NEVER!!! I will never give them another penny ever again! And all my family and friends are aware of what‚Äôs happened to me, they have seen all the emails and photos  and won‚Äôt be using them either! Appalling, dishonest company!!!! I also see the ‚Äúone star reviews‚Äù are staring to take over the better reviews! HARRODS GIVE YOURSELF A WOBBLE AND SORT IT OUT!

I visited Harrods Beauty, in Cribbs, Bristol yesterday evening with my daughter, excited to purchase some sprays and lotions with her pocket money. Unfortunately, our experience was completely overshadowed by the unwelcoming and uncomfortable behavior of a security guard.From the moment we walked in, he followed us closely around the store. Every time we stopped to look at a product, he stopped too. I even smiled awkwardly at him, hoping to ease the tension, but he continued watching us as if we were doing something wrong. Even my daughter noticed, whispering, ‚ÄúMummy, that man is following us.‚Äù It was clear that, for whatever reason, we were being unfairly targeted.As a Black woman shopping with my Black daughter, I couldn‚Äôt help but wonder if this was racially motivated. We were simply there to shop, yet we were made to feel like suspects rather than valued customers. This feeling stayed with me even after we paid‚ÄîI felt it necessary to hold the receipt in my hand, along with our purchase, just in case we were questioned, as if I had to prove we hadn‚Äôt stolen anything.This was especially disappointing because the rest of the staff were lovely‚Äîfriendly, welcoming, and even complimented my daughter‚Äôs choice of products. But no amount of kindness from them could erase how uncomfortable and humiliated we felt.No one should feel this way while shopping. I truly hope Harrods Beauty takes this feedback seriously and ensures that all customers, regardless of race or background, are treated with fairness, respect, and dignity.

Dear Harrods Customer Service management,I received the trainers today, March 5, 2025, at 13:50 PM, and I am absolutely appalled by what I have received. If this so-called ‚Äúrepair‚Äù was done by Dior, then I am even more disappointed. The damages have merely been painted over, which is a completely unacceptable and unprofessional resolution.I expected better service from both Harrods and Dior, yet this experience has been nothing short of disgraceful. I ordered a Prada handbag from Harrods online for my wife for Valentine's Day, as a nice gesture after a period of illness. I used Harrods as they had an expedited delivery service, and it was a trusted retailer ( or I thought so). The good news, it arrived on time but that's where the good news ended ; firstly the bag we received was packed into a generic Harrods outer box which was too small so the bag was crushed. Furthermore it was in a dirty outer dust bag, had all the labels already cut off and placed in a zipper compartment, straps undone, and worst of all was scuffed on the bottom. It was clearly not new and best case a display item, but most likely a customer return. Totally unacceptable for a bag costing full price ¬£4150. I was dismayed especially as it was to be a nice surprise for my wife, so I immediately ordered a replacement direct from Prada. This item came 2 days later in a beautifully presented branded box, labels attached, all the metal clasps carefully wrapped with soft tissue, and the bag filled with tissue - as one would expect of a new bag!I sent the original bag back to Harrods for review the same day I received it ( after having to drive 30 mins to the nearest DHL drop off) and waited patiently for a response. My credit card at this point had ¬£8300 on it ! Eventually I got news I would get a refund, but was absolutely 'gobsmacked' to hear that their internal review had shown it was sent out in good condition and had passed their internal checks. What?!So this is what to expect of a luxury retailer like Harrods? I've asked them to review their response with senior management ... all I want is an honest answer about how their team could allow an expensive handbag to be sent to a customer in such a bad state, and that was clearly not new. Or are they really happy for this to be their standard of service?

I will definitely be recommending Harrods Beauty and Christine to others.
